body_html:
Just wanted to give an update on this. The root cause appears to be a problem in the libpthread code used by Ubuntu 16.04 on POWER. More information is available at:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/glibc/+bug/1641241
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/glibc/+bug/1640518
https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=20822

The problem is independent of TF version. It's specific to POWER systems, so shouldn't appear on x86. And won't appear on Ubuntu systems prior to 16.04. IBM folks are working to get a fix into GLIBC/libpthread and then will work with Canonical to get a fix published for Ubuntu.

Thank you all for the suggestions! Closing the issue.

body:
Just wanted to give an update on this.  The root cause appears to be a problem in the libpthread code used by Ubuntu 16.04 on POWER. More information is available at:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/glibc/+bug/1641241
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/glibc/+bug/1640518
https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=20822

The problem is independent of TF version. It's specific to POWER systems, so shouldn't appear on x86. And won't appear on Ubuntu systems prior to 16.04. IBM folks are working to get a fix into GLIBC/libpthread and then will work with Canonical to get a fix published for Ubuntu.

Thank you all for the suggestions!  Closing the issue.
